business.headline: Ashneer Grover shares reason behind his one-day exit from EY. Check hereIn an old video, Grover shares why he left Ernst & Young (EY) on his very first day despite being offered a Rs 1 crore salary.

Government working on new income tax act. Check inside detailsThe new tax framework aims to replace the current 1961 act, simplifying the tax process for individuals and businesses.

RPSG's Firstsource expands globally, eyes $550 million boost from AIThe expansion is part of Firstsource's strategy to improve its business margins while continuing to create jobs in India. For every position created in Australia, the company plans to create three jobs in India.

Gold prices react to US Fed rate cut: What investors need to knowThe US Federal Reserve's rate cuts aim to stabilise the economy but raise concerns about their impact on global markets, particularly on gold prices, a key investment in uncertain times.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Politics in name of God: Former Andhra Chief Minister Jagan Reddy refutes charges amid Tirupati laddoos rowPolitics in name of God: Former Andhra Chief Minister Jagan Reddy refutes charges amid Tirupati laddoos row

Kicked on chest, flashed: Army officer's fiancée on Odisha police station ordealThe Army officer and his fiancée had approached Bharatpur police station to file a complaint about road rage. However, what followed was a harrowing experience for the couple.

Collegium not a search panel: Supreme Court pulls up Centre on judges' selectionAs per convention, the government is obliged to accept the collegium's recommendation for appointment of judges if the decision has been reiterated.

Gurugram biker death: Accused was previously fined for wrong side drivingGurugram SUV-bike crash: Akshat Garg died last week after his bike was hit by an SUV that was being driven recklessly in the wrong direction on Golf Course Road in DLF Phase II.

050507497 does not exist: When Israeli mobile bomb killed The Engineer in 1996Yahya Ayyash, popular as 'The Engineer', was Hamas's chief bombmaker whose devices had killed around 150 people. Spy agency Shin Beit used a cellphone bomb to kill Israel's most-wanted terrorist in 1996, when most of the world hadn't even seen a mobile. His killing came three decades before Hezbollah pager blasts in Lebanon.

Union Health Minister asks for report on Tirupati laddoos amid animal fat row Union Health Minister JP Nadda has sought a report on the alleged use of animal fat in the making of Tirupati laddoos and ensured that action will be taken after the examination of the report by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI).

Viral at Paris Olympics, Korean shooter Kim Yeji lands acting role as assassin South Korean Kim Yeji landed her first acting role, a month after she went viral at the Paris Olympics for her distinctive style at the range. Kim will work with Indian actor Anushka Sen in a spin-off series of the film 'Asia'

iPhone 16 buyer gets tired of queues, orders online and receives it in minutesThe iPhone 16 series sale is now live on both online and offline stores. The enthusiasts have been standing outside the store since last night, hoping to be the first ones to get their hands on the new gen iPhones. However, one customer was done with the queues and could not wait any longer. Here is what he did.

Changed ghee brand behind 'animal fat in Tirupati laddoo' controversy?Chandrababu Naidu's claim, citing a lab report, that animal fat was found in the ghee procured during the YSR Congress Party regime has brought into focus the halt in the supply of the famous Nandini ghee last year.

Mamata Banerjee writes to PM Modi over Bengal floods, seeks urgent action  In the letter to PM Modi, Mamata Banerjee urged the Centre to immediately release central funds to mitigate the widespread devastation caused by the floods.

Jagan Reddy's party approaches court amid 'animal fat in Tirupati laddoo' rowLawyers representing the party requested the court if a sitting judge or a committee appointed by the High Court could investigate the claims made by Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu.

Chinese zoo admits their 'pandas' are actually painted dogs after video goes viral A video of the 'painted dogs' has gone viral in which one of them was seen panting while lying exhausted on a rock inside a fenced-off area.

Supreme Court raps CBI for claiming Bengal courts are hostile, warns of contemptA bench of Justices Abhay S Oka and Pankaj Mithal expressed displeasure over the CBI's plea, stressing that the central probe agency had cast aspersions on the entire judiciary of West Bengal.

Supreme Court rebukes High Court judge over Pak comment on Karnataka localityDuring a recent hearing on a landlord-tenant dispute, Justice Srishananda called a Muslim-majority area in Bengaluru "Pakistan" and made a misogynistic remark involving a woman advocate.

How pager blasts, Hamas chief killing have brought Middle East to brink of warIsrael-Hezbollah War: Even though the intensity of the hostilities has waxed and waned, there is no sign of a pause in the year-long war in Gaza. The pager blasts in Lebanon have further pushed the Middle East to the brink of a full-blown regional war.

How Mahatma Gandhi framed Ambedkar in the Dalit struggleIn September 1932, Mahatma Gandhi began a fast from prison to oppose the separate electorate supported by Dr. BR Ambedkar, who believed it was vital for empowering the Depressed Classes. Gandhi's fast contradicted his principles of satyagraha and deepened the rift between him and Ambedkar while highlighting key issues of representation and identity in India's quest for equality.

Actor Shama Sikander on attempting suicide 15 years ago: Asked God to make a dealIn an interview recently, actor Shama Sikander remembered the most difficult phase of her life and talked about suffering from bipolar disorder. The Yeh Meri Life Hai star shared that she attempted suicide and was saved by her family.
Watch: Salman Khan strolls through Dubai Mall with heavy securitySalman Khan is currently in Dubai. The actor's video of enjoying his time in the Dubai mall has gone viral.

sports.headline: Tamim Iqbal hails Rohit Sharma, Jadeja's masterstroke on Day 2 of Chennai TestIND vs BAN: Former Bangladesh batter Tamim Iqbal hailed Rohit Sharma and Ravindra Jadeja's planning masterclass on Day 2 of the Chennai Test. Tamim said the Indian duo planned the wicket of Litton Das brilliantly.

Jasprit Bumrah becomes 6th Indian pacer to take 400 international wickets India vs Bangladesh: Jasprit Bumrah became only the 10th Indian bowler to take 400 wickets in international cricket. The fast bowler achieved the feat after taking 3 wickets in the first two sessions on Day 2 of the Chennai Test.

KL Rahul's temperamental problem has plagued his career: Sanjay ManjrekarFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has blamed KL Rahul's temperamental issues for his low returns in Test cricket. Rahul was dismissed for just 16 (52) on Day 1 against Bangladesh.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
